ci_support_linux_64_r_base4.4.yaml:
cdt_name:
- conda
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cran_mirror:
- https://cran.r-project.org
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  r-base:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
r_base:
- '4.4'

about.summary: R is great for installing software.  Through the 'installr' package you can automate the updating of R (on Windows, using updateR()) and install new software. Software installation is initiated through a GUI (just run installr()), or through functions such as: install.Rtools(), install.pandoc(), install.git(), and many more. The updateR() command performs the following: finding the latest R version, downloading it, running the installer, deleting the installation file, copy and updating old packages to the new R installation.

R is great for installing software.  Through the 'installr' package you can automate the updating of R (on Windows, using updateR()) and install new software. Software installation is initiated through a GUI (just run installr()), or through functions such as: install.Rtools(), install.pandoc(), install.git(), and many more. The updateR() command performs the following: finding the latest R version, downloading it, running the installer, deleting the installation file, copy and updating old packages to the new R installation.

name: r-installr
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = '0.23.4' %}

{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-installr
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/installr_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/installr/installr_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: d25da42088a0433b4b0a5440a3f89cdbae1074dc3b442c26766dbd3538679ce2

build:
  number: 3
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/
  noarch: generic

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip  # [win]

  host:
    - r-base
    - r-stringr

  run:
    - r-base
    - r-stringr

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('installr')"  # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('installr')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://talgalili.github.io/installr/, https://github.com/talgalili/installr/, https://www.r-statistics.com/tag/installr/
  license: GPL-2.0-only
  summary: 'R is great for installing software.  Through the ''installr'' package you can automate
    the updating of R (on Windows, using updateR()) and install new software. Software
    installation is initiated through a GUI (just run installr()), or through functions
    such as: install.Rtools(), install.pandoc(), install.git(), and many more. The updateR()
    command performs the following: finding the latest R version, downloading it, running
    the installer, deleting the installation file, copy and updating old packages to
    the new R installation.'
  license_family: GPL2
  license_file:
    - '{{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/GPL-2'

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r
    - thewchan

# Description: R is great for installing software.  Through the 'installr' package you can automate the updating of R (on Windows, using updateR()) and install new software. Software installation is initiated through a GUI (just run installr()), or through functions such as: install.Rtools(), install.pandoc(), install.git(), and many more. The updateR() command performs the following: finding the latest R version, downloading it, running the installer, deleting the installation file, copy and updating old packages to the new R installation.
